Text: With more TV and movies than ever right at our fingertips, where are you meant to begin?! Welcome to HELLO!'s TV and Film section where we aim to bring you all of the latest news, recommendations, interviews and more from your fave shows and movies of the moment - covering everything from dancing competitions to Netflix's hottest new drama. So sit back and enjoy the show! Model Abbey Clancy has curated another stellar edit with F&F at Tesco, with prices for the AW25 supermarket range starting at £10 In partnership with F&F at Tesco We spoke to women’s health specialist Dr Janine David for her top tips and product recommendations for menopausal skin during autumn and winter We’re in a new era of aesthetics, with more and more women seeking natural results from their beauty treatments In partnership with Galderma These comfy black leggings are in high demand, thanks to their smoothing, lifting abilities and athleisurewear vibes. Shop the viral black leggings. Supported by BetterMe The Art of Sarah is currently the number four most-watched TV show on Netflix and stars South Korean actors Shin Hye-sun and Lee Joon-hyuk The final four episodes of Netflix's hit period drama, starring Luke Thompson and Yerin Ha, arrive on Thursday, 26 February The Irish actress, who hails from County Clare, is one of 11 siblings, one of whom is also an actress who has starred in Casualty and Raw The Strike star returns to screens in mystery thriller The Stolen Girl on ITV, but did you know the Mancunian actress spent some time living in Hollywood? The Channel 4 series, Dirty Business, is based on a decade-long investigation about water companies dumping raw sewage. Jason Watkins and David Thewlis star Natalie Quarry, who plays Rosalind in Call the Midwife, sat down with HELLO! to chat about her upcoming role in period thriller Think of England The upcoming release of CBS and Paramount+'s Marshals: A Yellowstone Story establishes a new order led by The Walking Dead's Michael Cudlitz The Line of Duty and The Crown star, who plays Peter Hammond in Channel 4's latest factual drama, suffered the loss of his daughter Maude 15 years ago
